Requires administrator privileges :( only above 12~ players can use this solution (unless you're rich and have your own computer at such a young age!!)
I'm not rich and I had my first own computer at the age of 11 :(
ya i did odd jobs for money and bought my own

{{champion:90}}  or  {{champion:127}} 

Both can ult him as he ults on you, negating most of his burst and can help you build something other than Zhonya jsut to counter him. This lats until the Zed wisen up and buys a {{item:3140}} , it can surprisingly take a long time. Both of them can also manage to get free poke on him with {{champion:90}}  's E and {{champion:127}}  's Q. This can withle him down a bit and rduce the odds of a all-in (or ups your chances of winning said all-in if it happens anyways).

I usually start with {{item:3027}} , good lane sustain if you go {{item:3010}} first an gives you HP (again to survive his burst).

In the end it is a very skil (with your champion) dependent match-up.

I don't know why you guys are complaining to Riot about this though? They can't help it that nobody enjoys playing support. Support never has been and never will be a desirable role, and someone HAS to take it. So when you click fill, of course you will be filling the position that nobody wants!

So if Riot can't do anything about this then who can?  The answer is Riot is the only one who can do something about this in some way. I'm not saying I know the correct way to fix the issue ( although I have a few ideas ) but Riot is the only ones who have the power to make any changes to the game that would fix this.

Most people simply dont like to play support, that is their problem though, not Riots. The ONLY thing that could "be done" to eliminate "the problem" of people not wanting to support is to outright remove the role and make the game 4v4. Which is absurd and obviously stupid because some people DO like to support. 

The way that dynamic queue works could be tweaked, sure, but no problem exists. Especially now that you can simply choose to not play support. If a person doesnt want to support, they can avoid it 100% of the time.

> [{quoted}](name=Sageoffire,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=cQPOlhPd,comment-id=000500020000,timestamp=2016-02-20T04:53:57.752+0000)

The problem is that playing support is completely unrewarding.  The only people who have any way of doing that is Riot.  So yes, it is Riot's problem to solve.  If they made the role more rewarding ( again, I have a few ideas and i've seen a bunch posted both on these forums and reddit ) more people would want to play it.  

Add in the fact that supports get basicly no gold, no kills ( for some reason people think assists are unimportant ), don't last hit, and are expected to be ward dropping machines means they aren't fun.  A good support is priceless and I personally don't mind playing it every now and then but it's ultimately boring as hell and completely un-fun to the majority of players.  

You want more people to play support?  Talk to Riot because they are the only ones with the ability to change game mechanics and champions.  Nobody outside of Riot can do this.  It's Riot's problem 100% that barely anybody wants to play support because they do not make them more interactive and fun to play.
I'm pretty sure we get fked in the current ranking system as well. I'm pretty sure rank has more to do with how well you do, too bad supports rarely do "Well".

> [{quoted}](name=Rosewell8,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=cQPOlhPd,comment-id=00050002000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-20T06:40:36.462+0000)
>
> I'm pretty sure we get fked in the current ranking system as well. I'm pretty sure rank has more to do with how well you do, too bad supports rarely do "Well".

Except there is no official ranking for how well anybody does individually.  There have been countless ways to calculate this and Riot actually does do this. It would not surprise me one bit if Riot actually does rank people individually and just refuses to make it actually matter in game.  Another problem that can only be solved by Riot.  

There is already a psuedo ranking system in place with the mastery points.  Riot just refuses to expand on it and has refused for years and years.

The problem is that people don't like going un-noticed. If they aren't "Top damage" or "Most kills" then they aren't carrying because their e-peen isn't appropriately stroked. And there really isn't much that Riot can do about that.

It's the same in mmo's where no one wants to play the healer or the tank because then they aren't doing the high numbers.

And when it comes to actually playing support most will pick a support that gets the credit like thresh or blitz over one that wins games very consistently like Janna. Seriously if a champion that had a noticeable impact was as strong as Janna has been for the entirety of the games existence, no forum anywhere would talk about anything else.

Maybe Riot could compensate by giving more IP to play support but that wouldn't do anything for ranked.

> [{quoted}](name=Stillname,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=cQPOlhPd,comment-id=00050002000000000001,timestamp=2016-02-20T07:04:17.831+0000)

>

So Riot could actually change the way the game is played. They have done it countless times through nerfs, buffs, and changing how dragon works, how strong/weak turrets are, how baron works and the buff it gives, and the list goes on and on how often Riot changes the game in more ways than just one.  

There are a plethora of ways Riot could help this.  They just refuse to do anything about it in any meaningful way.  To try and place the blame on anybody other than Riot ( considering they have 100% control over how the game is played ) is absolutely ludicrous.  

Please give me the name of somebody who can change the way the game works and is played in such a substantial way that the entire player base is affected other than Riot and we can talk to them about it instead.  The answer is there isn't anybody other than Riot that can do this which is why people blame Riot.

BTW in MMO's I do play the tank and healer. DPS is boring as hell.  

If Riot were to implement a way to rank people based on their performance rather than allowing a single person on a team to completely throw the game then nobody could complain.  They refuse to do this as well even though they have all the data needed to do it.  They have already taken a baby step with mastery scores at the end of each match. They just have to expand on it but it's completely stupid to believe Riot will do this when they can't even give us solo queue like they said they would after dynamic queue came out.

Solo Queue would be the absolute perfect place to use a ranking system that ranked you based on your individual play.  Winning and Losing would still be important and would play a factor in your ranking but it wouldn't be the only factor.  Thinking that it can't be done is being very simple minded.  It is something Lyte would say.
